verses.text: O ye children of Benjamin , gather yourselves to flee out of the midst of Jerusalem , and blow the trumpet in Tekoa , and set up a sign of fire in Beth-haccerem : for evil appeareth out of the north , and great destruction.
I have likened the daughter of Zion to a comely and delicate \add woman\add*.\f + \fr 6.2 \ft comely: or, dwelling at home\f*
The shepherds with their flocks shall come unto her; they shall pitch \add their\add* tents against her round about ; they shall feed every one in his place.
Prepare ye war against her; arise , and let us go up at noon. Woe unto us! for the day goeth away , for the shadows of the evening are stretched out.
Arise , and let us go by night , and let us destroy her palaces. \p

¶ For thus hath the \nd \+w LORD|strong="H3068"\+w*\nd* of hosts said , Hew ye down trees , and cast a mount against Jerusalem : this \add is\add* the city to be visited ; she \add is\add* wholly oppression in the midst of her.\f + \fr 6.6 \ft cast…: or, pour out the engine of shot\f*
As a fountain casteth out her waters , so she casteth out her wickedness : violence and spoil is heard in her; before me continually \add is\add* grief and wounds.
Be thou instructed , O Jerusalem , lest my soul depart from thee; lest I make thee desolate , a land not inhabited.\f + \fr 6.8 \ft depart: Heb. be loosed, or, disjointed\f* \p
¶ Thus saith the \nd \+w LORD|strong="H3068"\+w*\nd* of hosts , They shall throughly glean the remnant of Israel as a vine : turn back thine hand as a grapegatherer into the baskets.

To whom shall I speak , and give warning , that they may hear ? behold, their ear \add is\add* uncircumcised , and they cannot hearken : behold, the word of the \nd \+w LORD|strong="H3068"\+w*\nd* is unto them a reproach ; they have no delight in it.

Therefore I am full of the fury of the \nd \+w LORD|strong="H3068"\+w*\nd*; I am weary with holding in : I will pour it out upon the children abroad , and upon the assembly of young men together : for even the husband with the wife shall be taken , the aged with \add him that is\add* full of days.

And their houses shall be turned unto others , \add with their\add* fields and wives together : for I will stretch out my hand upon the inhabitants of the land , saith the \nd \+w LORD|strong="H3068"\+w*\nd*.
For from the least of them even unto the greatest of them every one \add is\add* given to covetousness ; and from the prophet even unto the priest every one dealeth falsely.

They have healed also the hurt \add \+w of the daughter|strong="H1323"\+w*\add* of my people slightly , saying , Peace , peace ; when \add there is\add* no peace.\f + \fr 6.14 \ft hurt: Heb. bruise, or, breach\f*

Were they ashamed when they had committed abomination ? nay , they were not at all ashamed , neither could they blush : therefore they shall fall among them that fall : at the time \add that\add* I visit them they shall be cast down , saith the \nd \+w LORD|strong="H3068"\+w*\nd*.

Thus saith the \nd \+w LORD|strong="H3068"\+w*\nd*, Stand ye in the ways , and see , and ask for the old paths , where \add is\add* the good way , and walk therein, and ye shall find rest for your souls. But they said , We will not walk \add therein\add*.
Also I set watchmen over you, \add saying\add*, Hearken to the sound of the trumpet. But they said , We will not hearken. \p
¶ Therefore hear , ye nations , and know , O congregation , what \add is\add* among them.
Hear , O earth : behold, I will bring evil upon this people , \add even\add* the fruit of their thoughts , because they have not hearkened unto my words , nor to my law , but rejected it.
To what purpose cometh there to me incense from Sheba , and the sweet cane from a far country ? your burnt offerings \add are\add* not acceptable , nor your sacrifices sweet unto me.

Therefore thus saith the \nd \+w LORD|strong="H3068"\+w*\nd*, Behold, I will lay stumblingblocks before this people , and the fathers and the sons together shall fall upon them; the neighbour and his friend shall perish.
Thus saith the \nd \+w LORD|strong="H3068"\+w*\nd*, Behold, a people cometh from the north country , and a great nation shall be raised from the sides of the earth.

They shall lay hold on bow and spear ; they \add are\add* cruel , and have no mercy ; their voice roareth like the sea ; and they ride upon horses , set in array as men for war against thee, O daughter of Zion.
We have heard the fame thereof: our hands wax feeble : anguish hath taken hold of us, \add and\add* pain , as of a woman in travail.
Go not forth into the field , nor walk by the way ; for the sword of the enemy \add and\add* fear \add is\add* on every side. \p

¶ O daughter of my people , gird \add thee\add* with sackcloth , and wallow thyself in ashes : make thee mourning , \add as for\add* an only son , most bitter lamentation : for the spoiler shall suddenly come upon us.
I have set thee \add for\add* a tower \add and\add* a fortress among my people , that thou mayest know and try their way.
They \add are\add* all grievous revolters , walking with slanders : \add they are\add* brass and iron ; they \add are\add* all corrupters.
The bellows are burned , the lead is consumed of the fire ; the founder melteth in vain : for the wicked are not plucked away.
Reprobate silver shall \add men\add* call them, because the \nd \+w LORD|strong="H3068"\+w*\nd* hath rejected them.\f + \fr 6.30 \ft Reprobate…: or, Refuse silver\f*
